Among France's centrists, Macron's succession is still anyone's game
subhead: A year and a half ahead of the 2027 presidential election, no 'natural' candidate has managed to dominate the fractured former majority coalition. Edouard Philippe, the only declared candidate, has distanced himself from Emmanuel Macron, while Gabriel Attal has held back.

title: US government shutdown: Democrats split in the Senate, paving the way to end budget deadlock

BBC chief resigns after alleged Trump documentary scandal
subhead: Tim Davie resigned on Sunday after accusations that one of the BBC's documentaries had edited a speech by Trump in a misleading way. The criticism emerged over clips spliced together from sections of a Trump speech on January 6, 2021. The UK culture, media and sport minister called the allegations 'incredibly serious.'

title: Gang violence deepens Haiti's educational crisis
subhead: Lack of electricity, no cafeterias and overcrowded classrooms: Haitian schools have long suffered from structural weaknesses, exacerbated by the proliferation of criminal gangs. More than 1,600 schools have been forced to close across the country, deepening poverty among families.

title: L'Arrêt by The Grey, an American bistro in Paris
subhead: Mashama Bailey, a renowned figure in Southern US cuisine, has just opened a new restaurant in Paris. There, cornbread, Country Captain chicken and Savannah Red Rice are reinvented using French ingredients.

title: Israelis grapple with the unspoken questions of the postwar era
subhead: As the 2026 legislative elections approach, Israeli society faces deep divisions between an increasingly security-focused far right and a left tempted by emigration.

She was hanging from the Bataclan's window. He caught her hand.
subhead: Sébastien and Charlotte should never have met. Yet their lives have been inextricably linked since a tragic night in November 2015, when the young man saved the pregnant woman clinging to a window ledge as they both tried to escape the terrorists.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'Le Pen's RN has clearly positioned itself as the party of billionaires'
subhead: Having voted against the 'Zucman' wealth tax, Marine Le Pen's Rassemblement National now openly presents itself as a right-wing party on every level: It is nationalist, anti-immigrant, extractivist and hyper-capitalist.

title: Ukrainian soldiers' rotations on the front line are growing ever longer
subhead: The Cross of Military Merit, awarded by President Zelensky to two soldiers who held their position for 165 days, highlights the rising difficulty of rotating infantrymen under constant threat from Russian drones.
